answers.answer: Hi, probably this is peripheral neuropathy affecting nerves. How old are you? Any history of diabetes? Deficiency of vitamin B in the body is also related with peripheral neuropathy. Please give details about your symptoms.Please get your vitamin B levels done and try some vitamin B tablets or shots. There are other causes for neuropathy, to read about it do visit websitehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peripheral_neuropathy

Hi i've been experiencing tingling, numbness & cramps that come & go as well in my palms & in my feet....Now i've also had a recent sexual exposure because of which i'm under the observation for it & am undergoing tests...well the 6 week test came back negative & people who've been helping me feel it's a good sign that i'm indeed negative & on the right track......However i have read on the net on many websites that peripheral neuropathy is observed in a lot of cases where HIV infection occurs....now could my symptoms be PN ??? is so does PN occur this early after HIV infection..I'm waiting to take my 12 week Hiv test......but these symptoms have me worried....if indeed it's not HIV related what other situations could cause it...I'm 27 years old, weight around the 80 KG mark....have a history of smoking!!!!!
